content:
=== Game Rules ===
This is vgdl rule file:
BasicGame
	SpriteSet
		background > Immovable img=oryx/backBlack hidden=True
		wall > Immovable autotiling=true img=oryx/dirtWall
		sword > Flicker color=LIGHTGRAY limit=1 singleton=True img=oryx/pickaxe
		dirt > Immovable color=BROWN img=oryx/backLBrown
		exitdoor > Door color=GREEN img=oryx/door2
		diamond > Resource color=YELLOW limit=10 shrinkfactor=0.75 img=oryx/diamond3
		boulder > Missile orientation=DOWN color=GRAY speed=0.2 img=oryx/mineral1
		moving >
			avatar  > ShootAvatar   stype=sword frameRate=8 img=oryx/spelunky
			enemy > RandomNPC cons=1
				crab > color=RED img=oryx/scorpion2
				butterfly > color=PINK img=oryx/bat2

	LevelMapping
		. > background dirt
		- > background
		e > background exitdoor
		o > background boulder
		x > background diamond
		c > background crab
		b > background butterfly
		A > background avatar

	InteractionSet
		dirt avatar sword > killSprite
		diamond avatar > collectResource  scoreChange=2
		moving wall boulder > stepBack

		avatar boulder > killIfFromAbove scoreChange=-1
		avatar butterfly crab > killSprite scoreChange=-1

		boulder dirt wall diamond boulder > stepBack

		enemy dirt diamond > stepBack

		crab butterfly > killSprite
		butterfly crab > transformTo stype=diamond scoreChange=1
		exitdoor avatar > killIfOtherHasMore resource=diamond limit=9

	TerminationSet
		SpriteCounter stype=avatar limit=0 win=False
		SpriteCounter stype=exitdoor limit=0 win=True

This is vgdl rule in natural language:
Here’s one way to look at the game:

• Genre & Feel
 – It’s an action–puzzle platformer with elements reminiscent of classic arcade adventure titles (think Spelunky or Boulder Dash). You navigate a maze‐like level, avoid or defeat enemies, manipulate objects, and work toward a clear exit goal.

• Key Mechanics
 – Movement & Combat: You control an “avatar” that can shoot a sword. You use this weapon (or sometimes environmental tricks) to eliminate obstacles or foes.
 – Environmental Interaction: There are immovable walls and “dirt” tiles as part of the level. Some objects like “boulders” behave like missiles—you’ll need to avoid them and sometimes use them from above to “kill” other objects.
 – Resource Collection: “Diamonds” are scattered around as collectible resources. Picking them up boosts your score, and they’re essential for satisfying the door conditions.
 – Enemy Encounters: Various enemies (like crabs, butterflies, and an enemy NPC) move around. Some enemy–enemy interactions can even kill or transform them (for example, a butterfly contacting a crab can transform the crab into a diamond with a bonus point), so you might use their interactions to your advantage.
 – Special Door: The “exitdoor” is not a simple door that you just walk through. When you interact with it, it checks the number of collected diamonds (with a limit set at 9). This means you need to have at least a threshold number of diamonds (likely 10 or more) before the door “accepts” you and triggers the win.

• Objective & Win/Loss Conditions
 – Objective: Collect enough diamonds (and possibly other resources or score points) so that when you reach the exit door with the required amount, you can finish the level.
 – Winning: The level ends in your favor (win) when the logic tied to the exit door is satisfied (i.e. the door “dies” when you’ve collected enough diamonds, representing a successful exit).
 – Losing: If your avatar is eliminated (for example, by falling boulders or enemy contact) there are no more avatars left and you lose.

• Possible Overall Strategy
 1. Explore the Level Carefully: Move through the maze-like space and inspect areas to collect diamonds. Look for opportunities where enemy interactions (like a butterfly colliding with a crab) can help you gain extra resources.
 2. Manage Hazards: Keep an eye on boulders and walls. Some interactions (like getting hit from above by a boulder) can cost you points or even your life, so always be mindful of their movement.
 3. Utilize Your Sword Wisely: Your avatar’s sword isn’t just a weapon; it may interact with the environment (for example, dealing with “dirt”). Use it to remove obstacles or take down enemies when safe.
 4. Aim for the Exit: Once you’ve collected the necessary diamonds (aim for more than 9), head for the exit door. Make sure you time your approach so that you’re not vulnerable to enemy or boulder threats as you complete the final interaction.
 5. Balance Risk and Reward: Sometimes allowing certain enemy interactions might net you extra resources (like transforming a crab into a diamond). Use these systems to boost your score while keeping a safe distance from hazards.

In summary, you’re looking at an arcade-style platformer where exploration, resource collection, and careful combat all work together. Master the patterns of hazards and enemies, and plan your path to collecting enough diamonds so that when you reach the door, you trigger the win condition. Happy gaming!

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT
4: ACTION_DOWN
5: ACTION_UP

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game.

Action:3

I'm moving right from (9,6) with the goal of reaching the diamond at (9,12); this directed move toward a resource should help me work toward the required diamond count to activate the exit door.
